                Grossinger Distinguished Lecturer Series                                                                   International Hospitality Industry Investment Conference                                                                        Play                              Conferences        The NYU School of Professional Studies hosts an array of internationally recognized industry conferences each year. These gatherings, which are held in New York City and around the globe, foster important exchanges of timely ideas and information amongst scholars and industry professionals, and serve to broaden the academic scope and the professional contacts of the many students who attend them.              Schack Institute of Real Estate Conferences        REIT Symposium   Hosted by The REIT Center of the NYU School of Professional Studies Schack Institute of Real Estate, the annual REIT Symposium provides a unique forum for sophisticated, high-level discussion and has become a must-attend event for hundreds of senior executives in the real estate investment trust industry.           Learn More       Conference on Capital Markets in Real Estate   Hosted by the NYU School of Professional Studies Schack Institute of Real Estate, this annual conference features a distinguished roster of industry leaders who offer their expertise and predictions regarding real estate market trends, as well as their perspectives on and strategies for investing in U.S. commercial real estate.           Learn More       Conference on Sustainable Real Estate   The Center for the Sustainable Built Environment of the NYU School of Professional Studies Schack Institute of Real Estate hosts this conference that brings together leaders from the private, public, and academic sectors to discuss the most pressing issues related to climate change, resource efficiency, and the built environment.           Learn More          Tisch Center for Hospitality and Tourism        NYU International Hospitality Industry Investment Conference     Hosted by the NYU School of Professional Studies Preston Robert Tisch Center for Hospitality, Tourism, and Sports Management, the Conference is the premier hospitality finance and development forum of its kind, where global hotel CEOs, analysts, and other hospitality leaders gather to discuss the current state, the potential future, and the major developments of the industry.           Learn More          Finance, Law, and Taxation Conferences        Federal Real Estate Tax Conference     The two-day conference covers the latest developments, recent legislation, cases, and rulings affecting real estate and partnership taxation. Attendees are guided through in-depth general sessions and panel discussions by nationally recognized experts, including key government representatives, who provide insight into the most advanced tax issues.           Learn More       Institute on Federal Taxation     Held twice a year, the Institute addresses all major areas of taxation and attracts attorneys, both general tax practitioners and specialists; accountants; corporate treasury and compliance executives; tax managers; and financial planners who seek comprehensive information on the latest technical, legislative, and planning developments in the industry.           Learn More       Institute on State and Local Taxation     The Institute provides high-level updates, practical advice, and in-depth analysis of the most recent developments and current issues in all areas of state and local taxation. It attracts attorneys, accountants, state tax officials, tax directors, tax managers, and anyone who seeks stimulating and expert discussion on the latest technical, legislative, and planning developments in these continuously evolving areas.           Learn More       Tax Controversy Forum     This annual forum features interactive presentations made by expert practitioners who cover a broad range of topics regarding tax audits and tax litigation at all levels. Attendees explore practical solutions to relevant issues, and gain valuable insights from leading authorities across the profession.           Learn More       Summer Institute in Taxation     Comprised of eight individual conferences that range in expertise levels, the Summer Institute features leading national and international tax authorities who guide in-depth sessions on state and local taxation, partnerships, consolidated returns, trusts and estates, federal wealth tax, and international taxation.           Learn More         On this Page                            Thu 23 APR              DPB Alumni Panel & Discussion: Explore Corporate Culture with the Experts      6:00 PM                                  Fri 24 APR              An Exclusive Evening with Historical Fiction Author Michael Schein      6:00 PM                                  Sat 25 APR              McGhee Information Session - April 25, 2015      10:00 AM                                  Mon 27 APR              Graduate Information Session - April 27, 2015      6:00 PM                                  Tue 28 APR              M.S. in Global Affairs Online Information Session      6:00 PM                                  Tue 28 APR              IN PRINT: Christopher Woods – Sudden Justice: America’s Secret Drone Wars      6:30 PM                               View All Upcoming Events              Department Specific Conferences and Events     Career and Life Planning   Center for Advanced Digital Applications   Finance, Law, and Taxation     Foreign Languages, Translation, and Interpreting   Center for Global Affairs   George H. Event Planning Resources                 Event Information      Upcoming Events            4/22: BFA Thesis Show: Missing An Angel                 4/23: Psych Cafe: HDSI Research Spotlight                 4/23: NYU Forum on Site-Specific Performance                 4/23: Piano Artist Master Class Series          More events...                                   Upcoming Conferences       Financial Intelligence in Health Practice Environments: Planning for the Future April 25, 2015    This one day conference/symposium will update clinicians and new graduates on matters related to finances in health practice environments to plan for the future: Topics include: Affordable Care Act (ACA) /Obama care and its impact on health-care practitioners' businesses and adjusting to regulations, strategies for repaying school loans, tax savings, retirement and financially planning.    The conference will bring together experts from different areas of the health care and financial sectors and open conversations both within NYU (Sherry Glied the Dean of Wagner School, Steinhardt health departments, health students),and outside the NYU community (clinicians and insurance and financial institutions). Speakers will have diverse backgrounds spanning Health Care Policy (Glied [NYU]; DeJong [Georgetown], the insurance environment (Petrizzi; Ungvary), finance (Gobel; Valeriano ) and the clinic (Amir, Riedel, Meltzer).    Information about how to register for this conferece will be posted shortly. Please check back soon for more information.     Music Business Innovation Lab: Transmedia Collaborations for Executives     June 20-24, 2015       The Music Business Program at New York University's Steinhardt School of Culture, Education and Human Development, in partnership with Brazil's Fundação Getulio Vargas (FGV) International Affairs Division, offer a one-week, professional-level training lab in cross-cultural and transmedia innovation for music and media industry executives.       The intensive program analyzes emerging business models and international markets for music and media-- positioned at the intersection of several overlapping areas of industry . We examine existing and emergent strategies for designing hybrid business models to manage the dispersal of content across multiple platforms, including interactive websites, smartphone and tablet apps, social video games, music and video streaming services, live performances, and others on the horizon, such as virtual and augmented reality.       Integrated Marketing Communication for Behavioral Impact (IMC/COMBI) Summer Institute July 6-24, 2015    In collaboration with the World Health Organization. A three-week intensive for health and social development professionals who have the responsibility for designing, supervising or managing health education and other IEC/social mobilization programs to achieve specific behavioral goals. Prior communication training is not required for this Institute.                       This site, and all its contents, are Copyright ©        by New York University. All rights reserved.    Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development - 82 Washington Square East, New York, NY 10003
